thread.title: 9 locals advance to 2nd day at D-10 Golf Championships
thread.title_full: 9 locals advance to 2nd day at D-10 Golf Championships

author: Herald Staff reports
title: 9 locals advance to 2nd day at D-10 Golf Championships
text: GOLF District 10 Championships Mercer County area golfers got off to a good start Friday in the opening round of the District 10 Class AA Boys Golf Championships at The Country Club of Meadville. Seven of the 15 qualifiers are locals and will compete today for one of the eight spots in the PIAA Western Regional Championships Oct. 19 at Tom’s Run Golf Club, Blairsville. Mercer’s Mark Peters was the medalist on Friday with a 76 and holds a three-stroke lead over Harbor Creek’s Jacob Van Slyke. Other area golfers in contention are: Lakeview’s Chris Palutro (3rd, 80); Kennedy Catholic’s Jacob Wilson and Reynolds’ Taylor Zach (tied 5th, 82); Grove City’s Kyle Shingledecker (tied 10th, 83); Reynolds Jacob Reimold (12th, 84); Wilmington’s Matt Kinkela (tied 13th, 85). In the AA team competition, Saegertown won the crown with 347, followed by Harbor Creek (355), Slippery Rock (358), Wilmington (370) and Kennedy Catholic (382). Following are the individual scores for local squads (best 4 of 5 count): Slippery Rock: Collin Hyatt 87, Sam Isacco 91, Ken Rall 88, Josh Bowser 92, Justin Patricca 102. Wilmington: R.J. Pozutto 86, Matt Zimmer 100, Matt Kinkela 85, Erika Hoover 101, Kobe Emery 104. Kennedy Catholic: Jacob Wilson 82, Teddy Haaz 97, Kolby Bernat 105, Cory Haaz 98, Ben Taylor 130. Other locals who competed but didn’t qualify for the second day were: West Middlesex’s Ryan Dogan (86) and Travis Roberts (106), Hickory’s Brandon Cioffi (91) and Colton Pellis (97), Greenville’s Piercen Fenton (100) and Lakeview’s Nick Jenkins (104). In the AAA tournament, first day leader was Meadville’s Zack Ford with 73. Meadville won the team title over Cathedral Prep by one stroke, 321 to 322. In the girls competition at Riverside Golf Club in Cambridge Springs, Izzy Schell – a Sharpsville student who plays for Reynolds’ team – and West Middlesex’s Lexi Collins were the only two local players who advanced after the opening round into today’s finals. Schell posted a 90. while Collins had a 97. Golfers who shot 100 or better qualified for the second day and the top 4 after today’s round will move on to the Western Regional tourney. Fort LeBoeuf’s Carly Yovich was first-day medalist with 78. In the two-team AA team competition, Villa Maria topped Hickory by a score of 361 to 437. Hickory scores were: Kristina David 102, Annie Cricks 104, Kate Brown 110, Leah O’Kresik 121 and Lily Hall 123. “I’m just overly proud of what our girls accomplished,” said Hickory coach Craig Antush. “I really felt it was going to be quite a challenge to get here. It was just a year of playing consistent, but you get rewarded by playing Villa,” he laughed. “It was a fun year. I’m happy for Izzy and Lexi. Unfortunately only four players move on after Saturday.” Other locals who qualified for the girls tourney but didn’t make the cut after Friday were: Sharon’s Madeline Songer 118, Reynolds’ Brittany Fitzgerald 121 and Kelly Park 138, West Middlesex’s Kate Demarco 132, Alexis Langdon 152, and Maddie Bachetti no card; Jamestown’s Chelsea Bursby 142. GIRLS TENNIS • Mercyhurst Prep 5, Hickory 0 – Hickory High girls tennis team was whitewashed by defending PIAA Class AA champion Mercyhurst Prep, 5-0, Thursday at Pennbriar Athletic Club. Undefeated Region 1 champion Hickory concluded the regular season with a 14-3 overall record, losing non-region matches to Warren-John F. Kennedy, Fairview and Prep. The Lady Hornets won only 1 game in being swept in 3 singles matches, while their two tandems in doubles fared somewhat better. “It offered our girls a great opportunity to play against a state championship team; plus, get a preview of who they’ll be playing against on Oct. 22 in the District 10 Team Championships in Erie,” Hickory co-Coach Ed Newmeyer e-mailed. District 10 singles competition takes play today at Pennbriar A.C. Singles: Caitlyn Schultz (MP) def. Morgan Bender, 6-0, 6-1; Nicole Freeman (MP) def. Lauren McGongile, 6-0, 6-0; Audrey Bell (MP) def. Erin Hunter, 6-0, 6-0. Doubles: Francesca Kern-Sophia DiNicola (MP) def. Nikki Marrone-Anna Derloni, 6-2, 6-4; Alex Baldwin-Ruth Golden (MP) def. Kaylen Woods-Sarah McGongie, 6-4, 6-2. GIRLS VOLLEYBALL • Grove City 3, Meadville 1 – Thursday night at Meadville Area Senior High’s “House of Thrills,” the visiting Lady Eagles won, 25-23, 23-25, 25-19, 25-8, led by Hanah Santon’s triple-double. Grove City: MacGuire Gubba 10 digs, 6 kills; Hannah Santom 12 digs, 25 assists, 11 serving points; Halle Culmer 8 digs; Bailey Risch 6 digs, 8 kills; Khalidah Muhammad 7 digs, 6 kills, 8 serving points; Carla Cintron 8 kills, 5 blocks, 5 serving points; Ashley Jackson 5 kills. JV: Meadville, 25-21, 19-25, 15-13. • Kennedy Catholic vs. Lakeview – The Lakeview Lady Sailors swept the match Thursday night (stats and scores published in Friday’s edition). Kennedy Catholic: Donique Marcella 9 digs; Shadaya Freeman 5 kills. GIRLS SOCCER • Grove City 2, Slippery Rock 0 – Thursday night at Slippery Rock, visiting Grove City got goals from Brittany Mattson and Anna Williams. Assists were credited for Kyleigh Hyduchak and Camryn Skibinski, Coach Sam Williams reported. Sign Up / Sign In With your existing account from... {* loginWidget *}
